slides.title: Constitution Basics
slides.content:
**Adopted:** 26 November 1949
**Came into Effect:** 26 January 1950 (Republic Day)
**Father of Constitution:** Dr. B.R. Ambedkar
**Drafted by:** Constituent Assembly

**Features:**
- Longest written constitution
- 25 Parts, 448+ Articles, 12 Schedules
- Borrowed from various countries

slides.title: Fundamental Rights
slides.content:
**6 Fundamental Rights (Articles 14-32):**
1. Right to Equality (14-18)
2. Right to Freedom (19-22)
3. Right Against Exploitation (23-24)
4. Right to Freedom of Religion (25-28)
5. Cultural & Educational Rights (29-30)
6. Right to Constitutional Remedies (32)

**Article 32:** Right to Constitutional Remedies (Dr. Ambedkar called it 'Heart and Soul')

slides.title: Government Structure
slides.content:
**President:** Head of State, 5-year term
**Prime Minister:** Head of Government
**Parliament:** Lok Sabha (543) + Rajya Sabha (245)
**Judiciary:** Supreme Court (Chief Justice + 33 judges)
**State Government:** Governor + Chief Minister + Legislative Assembly

**Preamble Keywords:** Sovereign, Socialist, Secular, Democratic, Republic

question.questionText: On which date did the Indian Constitution come into effect?
question.explanation: The Indian Constitution came into effect on 26 January 1950, which is celebrated as Republic Day. It was adopted on 26 November 1949.
